summary: This is an email chain from March 2008 discussing the status of the state and federal cases against Jeffrey Epstein. It details the terms of a proposed non-prosecution agreement, Epstein's attempts to evade its requirements, and the relationship between the state indictment (involving two victims) and the federal investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in both state and federal investigations for solicitation of prostitution and child exploitation. The email details his attempts to negotiate a plea deal and then evade its terms.

events.title: Epstein's meetings with victims in state case
events.description: Epstein saw two girls who are charged in the state indictment in February and September 2005.

events.title: Scheduled state trial date
events.description: The state case currently has a trial date set for July 2008.

events.title: Negotiation of non-prosecution agreement
events.description: Discusses a proposed non-prosecution agreement requiring Epstein to plead to a state offense requiring sex offender registration, serve 18 months incarceration, and pay restitution. Epstein later tried to escape all three requirements.

keyFacts: The state indictment involves two victims from 2005, one of whom is also included in the federal indictment. The state charges are for solicitation of adult prostitution, not child exploitation.
A victim from the state case told Epstein her true age and he engaged in sexual intercourse with her just days before her 18th birthday, after which he gave her gifts including lingerie.
Before federal involvement, police were told Epstein would plead to a misdemeanor with no jail time, which prompted the FBI to step in.
Epstein's defense has been subpoenaing victims not included in the state indictment for depositions, potentially to gather information on the federal investigation.
Communication between the federal prosecutor and the State Attorney's Office ceased for over six months due to a defense demand for no contact.
